channel.title: AND Rules :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: In this section, we will see the deduction rules for the AND operator. AND introduction Clearly, when both p and q are facts, then so is the proposition p ∧ q. This makes logical sense – if two propositions are independently true, then their conjunction (AND) must also be true. The AND introduction rule, AndI, formalizes this: P Q AndI : --------- P ∧ Q We will use the format above when introducing each of our natural deduction rules:
